title: Honest John: zero emissions 'fantasyland' – what happens to the millions of petrol and diesel cars?
text:
If your car has developed a fault, or for consumer advice, turn to Honest John by emailing honestadvice@telegraph.co.uk

Zero chance

I am amazed that, to meet zero emissions by 2050, the problem of what to do about the millions of existing petrol/diesel cars has not been mentioned. The switch from petrol to battery is going to take years and, given the life of a well-maintained car, unless a complete ban is introduced the aim of zero emissions by 2020 is pure fantasyland. What do you think? RS

You’re right – 35 million vehicles cannot be replaced by zero-emissions alternatives over even 30 years, partly because sufficient zero emissions vehicles cannot be made in that time period; partly because...
